job_description: Business Analyst - job post Alcon 1,660 reviews Fort Worth, TX $120,160 - $180,240 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $120,160 - $180,240 a year Job Type Full-time At Alcon, we are driven by the meaningful work we do to help people see brilliantly. We innovate boldly, champion progress, and act with speed as the global leader in eye care. Here, you’ll be recognized for your commitment and contributions and see your career like never before. Together, we go above and beyond to make an impact in the lives of our patients and customers. We foster an inclusive culture and are looking for diverse, talented people to join Alcon. As a Business Analyst, you will help us in the pursuit of creating a digital product that continuously improves our relationship with Alcon customers, consumers and sales associates. The focus of this team is user experience. We don't just build what we're asked to build, we look into why we're being asked to build it to make sure we're solving the right problems. We love out-of-the-box ideas and questioning the norm. In this role, a typical day will include: Collaborates with the Product Director, Global Product Experience Manager, and other Business Analysts to shape end-to-end product strategy and business value Elicits requirements to meet team goals Delivers functional specifications Create and manage diagrams and product flows Collaborate with cross functional teams (Supply Chain, SAP, Customer Master/ Salesforce & Digital Health Suite/Smart Cataract) Serves as the day-to-day contact for the team on clarification of requirements Supports the Product Director in collaborating with other teams and leadership to ensure team strategy aligns with the overall product vision Supports business case building and value assurance of digital solutions Defines, implements and tracks product performance metrics Preps and supports team demos Works closely with the Product Director on priorities and day to day decision-making WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO ALCON: Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent years of directly related experience (or high school+13 yrs; Assoc.+9 yrs; M.S.+2 yrs; PhD+0 yrs) The ability to fluently read, write, understand and communicate in English 5 Years of Relevant Experience PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: Proficiency in JIRA, Agile and Scrum methodology Knowledgeable of SAP and Hybris backend Experience facilitating agile ceremonies, managing a backlog/release plan, tracking team level metrics, removing blockers (burndown chart, release burn up, etc.) HOW YOU CAN THRIVE AT ALCON: Benefit from working in a highly respectable and diverse environment. Join Alcon’s mission to provide outstanding, innovative products and solutions to improve sight, improve lives, and grow your career. Alcon provides robust benefits package including health, life, retirement, flexible time off, and much more! Travel Requirements: 5% Relocation assistance: Yes Sponsorship available: No Alcon Careers See your impact at alcon.com.careers Alcon is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. Alcon takes pride in maintaining a diverse environment and our policies are not to discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Alcon is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please send an email to alcon.recruitment@alcon.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Total Rewards Alcon’s Total Rewards programs are designed to align to incentives with business goals, encourage the right values and behaviors, and deliver long-term value. The first layer of our rewards program is compensation. We offer a combination of fixed pay and variable pay, which includes short-term incentives, and long-term incentives for eligible population. Our benefits program provides security for life events through life and disability insurance, supports savings for retirement, promotes good health and well-being and supports associates and their families during times of illness. To learn more about Alcon’s Corporate Social Responsibility including our Total Rewards, click here Pay Range $120,160.00 - $180,240.00 Pay Frequency Annual Alcon is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. Alcon takes pride in maintaining a diverse environment and our policies are not to discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Alcon is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please send an email to alcon.recruitment@alcon.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Quantitative Analyst / Data Scientist - job post Citi 19,182 reviews Irving, TX $89,620 - $134,430 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $89,620 - $134,430 a year Job Type Full-time Summary: The Model Analysis Group (MAG) is a growing team within Risk Modeling and Analytics (RMA) . It is responsible for all post model development analytics related to models developed by RMA teams, including Ongoing Performance Assessments (OPA), Annual Model Reviews (AMR), and Revalidations. Members of the MAG will be actively involved in different aspects of the model lifecycle. A typical model goes through different stages: design, calibration, testing, documentation, validation, implementation, monitoring and back to re-design and re-calibration when relevant assumptions change or monitoring indicates performance issues. OPAs and AMRs are critical stages of the model lifecycle to determine model performance (model use and monitoring) that can trigger model re-design or re-calibration by identifying critical issues. Thus the job is related to a critical stage/decision point; essentially whether or not the model can still be used, which in turn has a material impact on resources, timelines, and deliverables. Key mandates also include driving productivity enhancements in Model Analysis through innovation. The MAG will leverage cutting edge software and technology to reimagine the way we currently execute on this crucial phase of the model lifecycle, to the benefit of our partners, including model sponsors, developers, and Model Risk Management. As the MAG spans all RMA models, members of the MAG will have the opportunity to become well-versed in multiple risk stripes, with such skills training enhancing their mobility and growth potential within RMA and the larger Risk organization. The position will work very closely with others in the MAG, including the Head of MAG who reports to the head of RMA. RMA develops risk analytics for use by Risk, Finance and Product and Client Coverage teams on a global basis. The head of RMA reports to the Finance Chief Risk Officer. Key responsibilities: Stakeholders include various working groups, model developers, risk managers, business clients, model validators, internal and external auditors, and regulators. Engage with stakeholders accordingly to: Develop and implement methodologies, algorithms and diagnostic tools for testing model robustness, stability, reliability, performance and quality control of modelling data. Conduct on-going model performance analysis (OPAs), annual model reviews (AMRs) , and revalidations. Discover, understand and quantify model limitations Provide comprehensive interpretations, explanations and conclusions Work with partners to resolve model issues Enhance efficiency and effectiveness of implementation of post model development analytics. Automate and consolidate ongoing model analysis and the annual model review process across different models Migrate analytics to a production environment as appropriate Support various tasks in response to regulatory and internal risk management requirements. Develop, maintain and enhance technical documentation including project plans, model descriptions, mathematical derivations, data analysis, process and quality controls. Education: A PhD or Master’s in a technical discipline ( e.g. physics, mathematics, statistics, engineering, economics, financial engineering, operational research or similar). Qualifications: 4+ years of experience in a comparable quantitative modeling or analytics role, ideally in the financial sector. Fewer years of experience will be considered with advanced degrees. Postdoctoral researchers are encouraged to apply. Solid programming skills and experience with statistical data analysis, modelling techniques and numerical implementations. More specifically experience in Python Data Science Stack (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Jupyter and IPython), R, Shell Scripts, UNIX, VBA, C/C++ (basic knowledge), SAS, Version Controlling (Git/Bitbucket) and basic database skills in either Oracle or Sybase/SQL .You may at least have experience in three of these techniques. Experience in developing and maintaining detailed technical documentation for models, model validation, project plans and processes preferred (Experience in scientific research paper writing will be an added advantage ). Strong written and verbal communication skills, and ability to discuss technical issues with stakeholders. Ability to meet deadlines for product deliverables in a timely, proactive and entrepreneurial manor. Demonstrated project management and organizational skills and capability to handle multiple projects at one time. - Job Family Group: Risk Management - Job Family: Risk Analytics, Modeling, and Validation - Time Type: Full time - Primary Location: Irving Texas United States - Primary Location Salary Range: $89,620.00 - $134,430.00 - Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi . Outcomes Analyst III - job post Concentra 2,612 reviews 5080 Spectrum Drive, Addison, TX 75001 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview: Please be advised, if you are viewing this position on Indeed, that the salary rate/range set forth herein was provided by Indeed. Concentra's market specific rate/range will be provided during the interview process. POSITION SUMMARY: The Outcomes Analyst III position will support the reporting and analytical responsibilities within the Clinical Analytics department. Analyst will be responsible for all aspects of employer and clinical reporting and analyses, from determining data acquisition and manipulation to final reporting including comprehensive analysis of results, trends, and outcomes. Analyst will also be accountable for special projects, as needed. Responsibilities: THE DETAILS Complete utilization analyses to support clinicians: evaluate practice patterns, trends, outliers and opportunities lending insight to practice patterns or variation in outcomes statistics Generate standard reports (daily, monthly/quarterly) to support work comp utilization and reporting Develops and executes on low to medium level projects to implement solutions for reporting with frequent management input and supervision; while elevating issues to management when needed Complete utilization analyses to support external customers: evaluate clinicians' practice patterns and outlier metrics to explain alignment or deviation from clinical model Identify opportunities to improve, document and/or train others on reporting processes and procedures to gain efficiency and productivity Work with internal departments to customize reports/analyses for presentations and client meetings Contribute to UAT/Quality testing for new reports/dashboards and enhancements to outcomes system database (EDW) This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. SCOPE MEASURES Direct reports: No Indirect reports: No Budget responsibility: Not applicable Qualifications: EDUCATION/CREDENTIALS Bachelor’s Degree in Analytical Science, Math, Computer Sciences, Economics, or related field from an accredited college/university. Graduate degrees (Masters and/or Doctorate) are required if job related experiences do not meet the minimum years of experience requirement JOB-RELATED EXPERIENCE Customarily four or more years of analytical and technical application experience (healthcare experience is a plus) Must have the ability to assess a request to understand the client’s needs, use technical tools (such as SQL, MicroStrategy, Excel, etc.) to retrieve, cleanse, and analyze data, identify and understand impact of clinical practice patterns, and present results in a meaningful written dialogue with visuals created from technical applications (such MS Office). JOB-RELATED SKILLS/COMPETENCIES Concentra Core Competencies of Service Mentality, Attention to Detail, Sense of Urgency, Initiative and Flexibility Ability to make decisions or solve problems by using logic to identify key facts, explore alternatives, and propose quality solutions Outstanding customer service skills as well as the ability to engage with people in a manner displaying tact and professionalism The ability to properly handle sensitive and confidential information (including HIPAA and PHI) in accordance with federal and state laws and company policies Working knowledge of Microsoft Applications and other applications Effective analytical and problem-solving skills Proven database experience t(SQL) to manipulate large data sets for analyses Demonstrated ability to effectively manage projects and present information professionally and effectively to various individuals, groups, and others Excellent interpersonal and communication (both verbal and written) skills Ability to meet deadlines and be flexible when priorities are re-assessed Additional Data: Benefits 401(k) with Employer Match Medical/Vision/Prescription/Dental Plans Life Insurance/Disability Paid Time Off/Holidays Colleague Referral Bonus Program This job requires access to confidential and sensitive information, requiring ongoing discretion and secure information management. Concentra is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
